skill.name: Gmail Tools
skill.description: Secure Gmail access via IMAP/SMTP with 1Password credential storage. Supports listing, reading, searching, sending, and replying to emails with proper threading and attachments.

skill.author: ClementWalter

security_audit.summary: The Gmail tools skill provides legitimate email management functionality through standard IMAP/SMTP protocols. It uses 1Password for secure credential storage and includes proper authentication. The code is straightforward with no obfuscation or hidden functionality. However, it requires access to email credentials and performs network operations to Gmail servers.

medium_findings.title: External credential retrieval via subprocess
medium_findings.description: All scripts execute 'op' (1Password CLI) command via subprocess to retrieve email credentials. While 1Password is a legitimate password manager, this represents a dependency on external credential storage that could be compromised if the 1Password CLI is tampered with or if the system has malicious software monitoring subprocess calls.

low_findings.title: Hardcoded Gmail server addresses
low_findings.description: Scripts use hardcoded Gmail IMAP (imap.gmail.com) and SMTP (smtp.gmail.com) servers. While appropriate for Gmail-specific functionality, this prevents use with other email providers and creates a dependency on specific Google infrastructure.

content.value_statement: Tired of juggling email credentials across multiple tools? This skill provides secure Gmail access using 1Password for credential management, eliminating the need to store passwords in plain text while enabling powerful email automation.
actual_capabilities: List recent emails from any Gmail folder with configurable limits
Read full email content including HTML/text bodies and headers
Send new emails with file attachments via SMTP
Reply to emails maintaining proper thread continuity with In-Reply-To headers
Search emails using standard IMAP query syntax
limitations: Requires Gmail App Password (not regular password) and 2FA enabled
Depends on 1Password CLI being installed and configured
Gmail-specific implementation, not compatible with other email providers
IMAP access must be enabled in Gmail settings

use_cases.title: Automate email responses
use_cases.description: Quickly reply to common inquiries while maintaining professional threading and adding attachments when needed.

use_cases.title: Integrate email into workflows
use_cases.description: Incorporate email notifications, reports, and updates directly into development scripts and automation pipelines.

use_cases.title: Track project communications
use_cases.description: Search and organize project-related emails, ensuring important updates are never missed.

best_practices: Always use --dry-run when testing email replies to verify content before sending
Store 1Password item names in environment variables for easier account switching
Use specific IMAP search queries to find emails quickly instead of listing all
anti_patterns: Never use your main Google password - always generate App Passwords for security
Avoid hardcoding email addresses in scripts - use configuration files instead
Don't process emails in bulk without reviewing - always verify recipients before sending

faq.question: Is this compatible with Google Workspace accounts?
faq.answer: Yes, works with both personal Gmail and Google Workspace accounts as long as IMAP is enabled.

faq.question: What's the email sending limit?
faq.answer: Limited by Gmail's daily sending quota: 500 emails/day for Gmail, 2000 for Workspace accounts.

faq.question: Can I use this with other password managers?
faq.answer: Currently only supports 1Password CLI. Other managers would require code modifications.

faq.question: How are my credentials protected?
faq.answer: Credentials are never stored in plain text. They're retrieved securely from 1Password and used only for the current operation.

faq.question: What if I get authentication errors?
faq.answer: Ensure 2FA is enabled, you're using an App Password (not regular password), and IMAP access is enabled in Gmail settings.

faq.question: How does this compare to Gmail API?
faq.answer: This uses standard IMAP/SMTP protocols instead of Gmail API, avoiding complex OAuth setup while maintaining security through 1Password.
